verbose_text: Thrombi were unstable and prone to embolization upon isoquercetin treatment; this may be due to impaired integrin alphaIIbbeta3 outside-in signaling, which has a proven role in thrombus stabilization and is shown in the present study to be attenuated by quercetin and its methylated metabolites.
evidence: integrin alphaIIbbeta3 outside-in signaling, which has a proven role in thrombus stabilization and is shown in the present study to be attenuated by quercetin
